result.execSummary:
The defendant Amos Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Court waived the costs, surcharges and assessments, but the Court did order the mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, 1 domestic abuse, and 2 DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall rsult i a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence and as to count three.  Credit for 241 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime/part time employment and/or schooling.
No contact with the victim unless modified by the agent.  Once released no contact with the victim unless modified by the agent.

Take all prescribed medications.
Participate in any anger management courses and cooperate fully.
Participate in and cooperate fully:   a Batterers Intervention Program (BIP) and  parenting classes.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Must provide a DNA sample for the State Crime lab 973.046 & 973.047.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms, body armor or weapons at any time in the future.  941.29 Wisconsin stats makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 years of imprisonment of a $25,000.00 fine or both.  Possess weapon as a convicted felon 973.176(1).
Defendant cannot vote in any election unti civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive as to count one.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as listed in count one.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement made as to sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. Statement also made by the victim Lekesha A. Presentence Report reviewed.

AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, and as to Count 3, with credit for 241 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Previously Dismissed and Read-In on 06-16-2014.

AS TO COUNT 3:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, to run consecutive as to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  


Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOWS:
*  Court WAIVED the costs, surcharges, and assessments, but the Court did ordered the mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, 1 Domestic Abuse, and 2 DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  Participated in any anger management courses and cooperate fully
*  No contact with the victim unless modified by the agent. Once released no contact with the victim unless modified by the agent.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab - 973.046 & 973.047.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms, body armor/ or weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wisconsin Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year of imprisonment of a $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant cannot vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Batterers Intervention Program (BIP) and cooperate fully
*  Participate in parenting classes and cooperate fully

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Court held in chambers conversations with defense and state prior to case being called. Defense counsel advised court of sentencing issue that requires further investigation prior to proceeding, requested adjournment. Case adjourned for Sentencing to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.
Received & Filed, Pre-Sentence Investigation Report.
Received & Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 627
ORDER FOR PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT (PSI), FILED

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In for Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3
 Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant he must provide a DNA sample and pay for that sample. Court ordered a Pre-Sentence Investigation Report. PSI Order, signed and filed. Court ordered defendant Remanded pending sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Motion Hearing. Court ordered sequestration. Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Henry Flemming. Sworn for the state: David Bettin. Received state's exhibit #1. Arguments from state and defense. For reasons placed on the record the court DENIED defense motion to suppress. Parties ready to proceed to Jury Trial, case passed to 1:30 pm.
Received & Filed, State's Memorandum of Law - Consent and Exigent Circumstances.

Attorney Scott F Anderson in court, defendant Amos Johnson not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  1 of state's witnesses unable to appear. Case is adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial, court to hear motion on day of trial.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court held sidebar conversation with parties in chambers, conversation placed on the record. Case was set for Motion Hearing. Case is adjourned for a Motion Hearing for reasons placed on  the record to branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, State's Memorandum of Law Regarding Defendant's Standing To Raise A Fourth Amendment Challenge.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion To Suppress Evidence-Illegal Search of Residence.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel motioned to adjourned Jury Trial date, recently appointed and requests a Motion date. Court VACATED the jury trial date of 5/19/2014. Case set for Motion Hearing  and Jury Trial in branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript of JURY TRIAL (ADJOURNED) & DEFENSE MOTION TO WITHDRAW (GRANTED) (7 pages) commencing 4/7/2014 received and filed.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scott Anderson appointed as counsel. Case to remain set for Jury Trial. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial prior to trial date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dick informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed. Court advised defendant the speedy trial demand has been extended to allow new counsel to be appointed. Case set for Status of Counsel date, and Jury Trial in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Amos Johnson not in court, in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, defendant NOT produced. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Case passed to address calendar.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List, State's Motion In Limine, and  Notice of State's Intent To Use DNA Evidence.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. State's offer is withdrawn as of today's date. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 04/07/2014.

Pro se motion received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer David Bettine.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense counsel requested case be set for Final Pretrial & Jurty Trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lakesha A.,m Tanika J. and Leana T.

Defendant Amos Johnson in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Amos Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
